organic_results.title: University faculty and attitudinal militancy toward the employment relationship
organic_results.snippet: Several possible determinants of militant attitudes toward the employer-employee relationship among 454 faculty members at one medium-sized university were investigated. Dissatisfaction with several job and organizational context characteristics (especially with the campus administration) were significant predictors of militant attitudes, but demographic characteristics (eg, sex, academic rank, tenure status, academic department, faculty organization membership) had very little predictive value. Faculty militancy may be more a …
